description: Yiddish שלימזל‎ (shlimazl), from Middle High German slim (“crooked”) and Hebrew מזל‎ (mazzāl, “luck”)

entries.meaning: (colloquial, chiefly US) A chronically unlucky person.
examples: I must have pressed two buttons at once, he decided; jammed the works and got this schlimazl’s eye view of reality.
